definition:
Fibromyalgia (FM) is a
medical condition characterized by chronic widespread pain and a
heightened pain response to pressure. Other symptoms include
tiredness to a degree that normal activities are affected, sleep
problems, and cognitive dysfunctions. Some people also
report restless legs syndrome, bowel or bladder problems, numbness and
tingling and sensitivity to noise, lights or temperature. Patients
with fibromyalgia are more likely to suffer from depression, anxiety
and posttraumatic stress disorder.[from Wikipedia]
